subject: World Cup (Skiing)
Amputation
Skiing
Legs
lead_paragraph: Matthias Lanzinger of Austria had his lower left leg amputated Tuesday because of complications after breaking two bones in a crash at a World Cup event in Kvitfjell, Norway. Lanzinger, 27, broke his tibia and fibula Sunday during the super-G event. The double fracture severely damaged blood vessels, which hampered blood circulation in the leg. The Austrian ski federation said surgery Monday night was only partly successful and left doctors no other option in an effort to avoid further health risks.
